results.definition: the attribute of being capable of rapid acceleration
examples: his car has a lot of pickup

results.definition: mechanical device consisting of a light balanced arm that carries the cartridge
a light truck with an open body and low sides and a tailboard
an electro-acoustic transducer that is the part of the arm of a record player that holds the needle and that is removable

examples: she needed the pickup that coffee always gave her

results.definition: a casual acquaintance; often made in hope of sexual relationships
a warrant to take someone into custody
examples: put out a pickup on that man

results.definition: the act of taking aboard passengers or freight
the act or process of picking up or collecting from various places
examples: garbage pickup is on Mondays and Thursdays
